title: Liverpool news: Jurgen Klopp admits Man Utd put his side off their game
text:
Jurgen Klopp is yet to win at Old Trafford (Picture: Getty Images)

Jurgen Klopp admits that Liverpool struggle to ‘be themselves’ when they take on Manchester United at Old Trafford.

The Reds have not won away to their fierce rivals since 2014 and could only manage a 1-1 draw when the sides met last Sunday in Manchester.

Having finished 31 points ahead of United last season, there is no doubt that Liverpool are superior to the Red Devils these days, but they clearly have a mental block at Old Trafford, and Klopp knows that he must come up with a new plan to fix this problem.

‘For us, we have to improve how to play an away game at Manchester United because once again we were not really ourselves,’ said the German ahead of Liverpool’s clash with Tottenham on Sunday.

‘It’s true, when they are against us, since I’ve come to England, they set up in a different way.

‘With Tottenham it’s different, it’s a home game. With Tottenham it always feels as though if they do this [clicks fingers] then they are back again.’

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer frustrated Jurgen Klopp at Old Trafford (Picture: Getty Images)

The ‘different way’ Klopp believes United set up against Liverpool is much more defensively than they do against other teams.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s tactics very nearly gave his side a victory last Sunday as it took a late Adam Lallana equaliser to rescue a point for Klopp’s men at Old Trafford after Marcus Rashford opened the scoring in the first half.

‘I’m not the person who should be frustrated by United’s style,’ said the Liverpool boss. ‘In the last years they just defend, that’s how it is, it’s no criticism, it’s just a fact.

‘When you think United v Liverpool you think both teams attacking, but it’s not. You [United] can’t play against each team like this.’

Klopp is clearly expecting a much more open game against Spurs on Sunday when Mauricio Pochettino takes his team to Anfield.

Although, how offensive Pochettino will want to be on Merseyside is yet to be seen, after the Argentinian described the Reds as the favourites to lift the Premier League title this season.

‘Yes, Liverpool is the favourites,’ said the Spurs boss. ‘Of course it’s so early in the season but Liverpool and Manchester City are the clear favourites to win the title this season.’
